snippet: In Hawaii, the effort to pick up tons of plastic that washes ashore may seem futile, but it is better than doing nothing.
abstract: Editorial warns of large, growing patches of plastic waste in world's oceans, noting that they present serious threat to wildlife; praises Hawaii Wildlife Fund for organizing cleanups of beaches where trash washes up in vast patches; notes that world leaders have been far less effective in their efforts to curb long-term proliferation of waste.
lead_paragraph: In Hawaii, the effort to pick up tons of plastic that washes ashore may seem futile, but it is better than doing nothing.

headline.seo: From Ocean to Beach, Tons of Plastic Pollution
